analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, The Paṭṭhāna text with the Tika commentary
The wholesome triad, the triad of what leads to increase

original: Nakusalaṁ naācayagāmiṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kusalo ācayagāmī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na kusalam na ācaya gāmim dhammam paccayā kusalaḥ ācaya gāmī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With a wholesome and not leading to increase state as condition, a wholesome and leading to increase state arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, six … With outflows as condition, six.

original: Nakusalaṁ naapacayagāmiṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kusalo apacayagāmī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nakusalaṁ nanevācayagāmināpacayagāmiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī
analyzed: na kusalam na apacaya gāmim dhammam paccayā kusalaḥ apacaya gāmī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na kusalam na neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmim dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmī
translated: With a wholesome and not leading to decrease state as condition, a wholesome and leading to decrease state arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as three … With outflows as three.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca adhipatiyā pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: With a wholesome and neither leading to increase nor leading to decrease state as condition, a neutral and neither leading to increase nor leading to decrease state arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as five, with predominance as five … With outflows as five.
